title: How to become an online tutor - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are an expert in a subject or good at teaching, online tutoring may just be for you. Many companies offer you jobs as online tutor. Some of them are quite well known like Chegg, Coursehero, Matr, Cuemath, Vedantu etc. You can also start online teaching through sites like Udemy or you can consider starting your own youtube channel for teaching a specific subject. However, sources like Udemy, Unacademy or Youtube don't give you the satisfaction of live interaction with your students. If you are someone who enjoy the thrill of teaching live and interacting with your students, and monitoring them regularly I would recommend Cuemath to you. With over 5000 centers, Cuemath is one of India's largest educational venture. It specialises in teaching Math to school going students from grades UKG to 10, with both offline and online centres. While the online centres caters to needs of students from across the globe, offline centers cater to the needs of the centre's neighborhood. According to a rough estimate, over 75% of school children go for tuition in Math, so the potential of Cuemath's growth is rich. Both students and teachers log into the online portal for their class. The class is moderated by Cuemath. They have their scientifically designed learning plan and lessons unlock accordingly. However, to qualify as an online teacher you will have to go through an in house screening test and training separately. Further, one needs to have a successful physical center running. The set up of offline centre is a low cost and hassle-free process as I will discuss here. Cuemath has grown exponentially since its inception just six years back. One of the main reasons for its success, apart from its well researched curriculum and world class content is that the amount of investment required to start a centre is very low. There is just a one time fee of Rs. 7000 which one needs to make for buying a math box, which is an essential tool for conducting the classes. Apart from this, you need to purchase a tablet (if you don't have one) to conduct your classes. Considering the investment, earning potential is great. Most teacher partners giving as little as 3 to 4 hours a day, earn as much as 40000 rupees a month. It is important to keep in mind that your earning, depends on the time and effort you put in. The physical centres are run on a franchise model, with the teacher and Cuemath sharing both responsibilities and earnings. A dedicated team is present 24×7 to respond to all your queries and troubleshoot any business related problem. Besides, they also help in digital marketing of your centre. As for earnings, they are shared in a ratio of 60:40,with teacher retaining 60% of the share. Your share is transferred to your account in a timely manner and you get regular account statements from the finance team. They have recently entered the arena of online tutoring and are already doing great. Teachers are happy, so are the parents and students. You can read a few parent and teacher testimonials to know how satisfied they are of Cuemath. So, whether you are a parent looking for a great maths tutor for your kid or a teacher looking out for opportunity in online teaching, Cuemath can address all your concerns. For further information, please visit our website. You can find the link to it on my profile.

For years, whenever people wanted to earn some additional income, the easiest thing to do would be to turn to tutoring. If you were good at something, you could easily pass the knowledge onto someone else, right? Well, today’s no different, except for the fact that technology has evolved and you now get to teach people online, as well, and not only in person. In some ways, it’s a lot easier because you can do it from the comfort of your home, have a lot of resources available to you at all times, and can work through a variety of online learning platforms.  Now, with that in mind, what exactly do you need to do become an online tutor? Decide what it is that you want to teach other people. Are you good at a certain language? Do you want to teach people how to be more productive? Sit down and write down what you know you are the best at and then use that to come up with the concept of your online classes.Brush up on the skills you’re going to use. Before you go out and start offering your knowledge to the rest of the world, you might want to polish it a bit. Unless you’re already working as a teacher somewhere and are using these skills on a daily basis, this is not a bad idea!Find an online tutoring platform on which you’ll offer your classes. Luckily, there’s a whole variety of them out there, so you don’t have to worry about whether or not you’ll find the right one for you. Some of the most popular platforms are definitely Udemy, Coursera, Lynda, Zeqr, and SkillShare. They have their similarities, but also differences, so it’s important to go through them carefully and choose which one would be the best fit for you.Register on your platform and create a class. Once you’ve picked out the tutoring platform of your choice, you’re going to want to create an account and your very first class. It might take some time for you to get students, but it’s important not to give up!Of course, if you already have students and don’t want to work with a platform, you can choose to become an independent tutor. This is the most difficult path, seeing that it’s harder to get new students this way, and it takes a lot of dedication on your part. This is a good choice for someone who’s already been tutoring for a while and is looking to separate themselves from a platform. So, there you have it! Hope you’ll manage to find some great tutoring jobs soon enough and kick off your career! :)

Teaching is no longer a drab subject but has become a lot interesting and challenging. Teachers now connect with students over laptops, tablets, iPads and mobile phones. Digital India is slowly transforming how we Indians consume products and services. Both parents and the students are enjoying the online learning experience. As a result, the demand for online tutors is growing fast. Note, although it is fun and rewarding, it comes with a great deal of hard work. If you like helping others to learn, online tutoring could be the earning ticket for you. Skills Required: Choose a subject in which you are an expert or a topic that you are comfortable in teaching. Identify your level of experience and the grades you can comfortably handle. Topics can be anything – math, science, languages, computer science, commerce, economics, anything. . .Teaching methodology, using slides, interactive activities, gamified lessons, storytelling, which will make the learning more engaging. This helps the students focus while enjoying their studiesBasic IT skills to be able to use online teaching platforms.Some experience as an online tutor is a plus, but not necessary.How to Become a Home Tutor? You have two options: Create your own tutorial platform or Sign-up with an existing tutorial website. In the first choice, you have to consider the following things Who is your target audienceHow will you convince them to choose you over othersHow will you compete against the competition?Teaching modalities (check the skills required section for more details)Managing the portal and other technicalitiesRemember, anyone can be an online teacher–professional teacher, subject matter expert or even a student looking for an additional income. Online tutors should have sufficient teaching experience, both on the subject as well as with teaching The alternate option is to sign-up with the online tutoring sites. They will assign you students, for a fee, based on your profile and schedule. Many of them have ready-made content, online video tutorials, etc, where your role will be that of a scheduler, or a provider of teacher-student interaction. These platforms also provide a real-time classroom experience that makes your teaching more engaged and interesting! Some examples of online tutors are Udemy, Udacity, SkillShare, Edx, Vedantu, TutorVista, Pearson, Tutor, etc Have you heard of Cuemath? Cuemath is an after school math learning program for school going students (KG to 10). One of the fastest-growing brands, Cuemath has over 5000 Teacher-Partners from all over the country, running their centers from the comfort of their homes. Cuemath Advantage Cuemath specializes in teaching fundamentals of math to school going students KG – 10th grades. Cuemath has a well researched and designed curriculum by IIT and Cambridge alumni. According to a survey, there are over 75% of the school-going-students who are in need of help with their maths learning. This shows how huge the market is with millions of potential students looking for tutors. Cuemath is a brand well accepted and established, with over 100,000 enrolled and the number continues to grow. Online teaching from home Cuemath offers both online and at home teaching math options for those who have a passion for teaching math. At-Home teaching model is for kids from KG to 6th-grade students and the online is for higher classes (7th to 10th grades). Currently, online course is also offered for those living abroad, through live one-on-one sessions. The advantage of online teaching is to ensure instant feedback and instant error recognition and better learning outcomes. To take up this role, you have to be well versed with the mathematical ideas and concepts as well as the knowledge of handling teenage students. Hence, teachers for this program are recruited only after rigorous training and assessment to ensure quality deliverance. It's a brilliant opportunity for women looking for online teaching jobs. Follow the link in my profile for more details about Cuemath and join the Cuemath teaching community

Becoming an online tutor isn’t as hard as it used to be. It has always been one of the best industries to work in.  I spoke to a couple of tutors and asked them how they were able to make the switch to online tutoring. While doing my research I also bumped into a very informative blog series. Here I am collating are a couple of points to keep in mind while starting your online tutoring business: Choose your niche. It’s very important to stand out in a competitive industry like the tutoring industry. It helps you set the direction for everything.Understand your audience. You need to ask yourself what do your potential customers value? Is it professional tutoring, personalized attention, or regular feedback. This will help you develop a top-notch sales pitch and offerings that will appeal to them.Look around you and analyze your competition. Highlight your unique selling proposition or USP. It’s the differentiating factor for your business that makes you stand out from the competition.What’s your payment model going to look like? There are a couple of factors to keep in mind when deciding on a payment model. Location, subject expertise and qualification and competitor price point are going to mould your payment model as well.And lastly, finalize the tools that you need. For online tutoring, deciding on tools that you’re going to need for the smooth functioning of your business is going to be key. At the very base, you’re going to need a video conferencing and scheduling software. You should check out Appointy’s integration with Zoom that makes scheduling video sessions seamless.For a deeper insight, you can check out the blog series here: How to become an online tutor: A guide for Covid-19 and beyond! It will walk you step-by-step through starting your online tutoring business.

Hi, So, you want to be an online tutor but not really sure how to proceed? This step-by-step guide may come in handy for you as it will help you understand better how to start your online tutoring journey without facing any hiccups and why you should embrace technology to move forward. 1. Initial Planning: Do not venture into online tutoring blindly without a concrete plan in place. From the choice of subject to the kind of students you want to teach, to even the time you want to spend teaching – everything needs to be planned. 2. Devise a Contract: It is a commitment by you to teach as it is for the learners and students to learn (and to pay you). 3. Go for an elearning tool: I would say that online tutoring has completely revolutionized the way teachers impart knowledge and reach out to their students. Today for a tutor ‘the world is a stage’ with the right skills and teaching experience. Thanks to the advancement in technology a tutor can be based anywhere from Kenya to the US. In the recent years, many online tutors have started using elearning platforms to aid the remote teaching process. You may ask why an elearning tool? Well, the reason is simple and straight. It will streamline the tutor and the student interaction and make it easy for you to teach effectively outside the traditional classroom environment. Want to know how an elearning platform will let you engage in online tutoring? Here are some of the key things you will be able to do when you go for an online learning tool (such as ProProfs learning management system ) a) Create courses: This cloud-based learning management system (LMS) will allow you to build and create courses faster with no technical knowledge. It isn’t intuitive just for the trainers but also for the students as ProProfs LMS is easy-to-navigate system and comes with automated features and streamlined processes. This tool will let you create customized courses with simple ‘drag and drop’ feature. If you already have some existing created courses, this tool will let you copy and paste, import the current files, docs, videos, and other formats as well.  b) Add assessments - You can test (using quizzes and assessments) to find out if the learners are making right progression or not by integrating ProProfs LMS with Quiz Maker.  c) One click publish - In ProProfs LMS, the smart preview button will let you instantly review the course and even share it with anyone via a link or an embedded course on your website or blog.  d) Sync PPTs - You can use powerpoints and slides that explain tough subjects by including images, text, videos and audio.  e) Access learners skills - With ProProfs LMS, you can use online questionnaires to judge the skill-level of students before they start the course and also collect their feedback at the end so that you can make necessary changes in your content to increase adoption.  f) Compatible with varied devices and OS - This tool enjoys compatibility with different devices (Android, iPhone, iPad etc) and OS. So, it gives complete freedom to the students and instructors to access learning from anywhere anytime without feeling restricted.  g) Custom branding/white labeling - If you want to customize the design and embed on your website, ProProfs LMS will let you do that as well. You can design your courses right from the scratch or choose a specific style from a library of hundreds of templates. h) Effective management of learners - This enterprise-grade platform will let you create virtual classrooms for managing a large number of learners and issue training completion certificates to your course takers as well. i) Advanced reports, track and measure your learner's performance - Teaching alone is not enough – as an instructor, you have to assess your students’ progress and adjust your delivery accordingly. This tool will give you a clear picture of how the learners are progressing by sharing a detailed report of completed, pending and in-progress attempts of each student. eLearning may not offer the face-to-face examination of a student but when you are using an LMS tool offer a plethora of novel ways to measure your students’ progress, with the added benefit of automating the tedious manual grading process. j) sell your courses - Yes, ProProfs LMS allows you to make money by selling your course as well. Just create a course, set up a seller account, set a price for your course or quiz and you are good to go. k) Free plan - This plan will let you create unlimited courses and offers unlimited storage (for documents, videos and images) for the first ten learners. If you have more than 10 learners, then you can go for the other plans - professional, team, business and enterprise. Venturing into the world of online tutoring is easy with ProProfs web-based LMS. It is ready-to-use and won’t take much to get started or make a transition from offline to online. I hope that you find this answer helpful. Best of luck!

To become an online tutor you should follow the few steps which will help you build a prominent career as an online tutor. So I recommend you the next steps: Determine your requirements which means that you need to find different and clear aspects, prerequisites, pros and cons of the online tutoring business before starting. Know your audience or in other words define your potential customer (age, gender, location, their needs, etc). The more details the better. Choose your subject. Maybe, the most important point in this list. I think you already know your strengths and have decided what you want to teach others. Prepare the materials that will help up teach students (books, articles, video, etc). Choose an online platform to promote your services and find students. This point is also very important although, at first glance, it seems not so important and difficult. There is a demand for online education that every year significantly grows, but the tutor doesn’t have any conducted lessons. That’s why you need to take some time and do deep research on online educational marketplaces and define where it’s better to work and find students. 2 years ago I studied applied mathematic at university and had some spare time to make money. This is how I became a teacher, not for so long time but it was really unforgettable experience. I had been teaching math on Preply. I was lucky because in this field there was not so big competition but and demand was not so high as desired. I had earned not big money nevertheless, it was a good additional income to make livings at that time.

I'm sorry this won't be an exact answer to your question as I found online tutoring to be a waste of time and little return for me. I live in Austin, Texas, which has 3 colleges that I regularly taught students of. ACC, UT, and St. Edwards. I find that you make the most money in person as a tutor for middle school-college students working on common subjects such as math, calculus, statistics, physics, chemistry etc… To start out use a site called university tutor with a premium $20/month account, I had the best students from that site, and their form forces people to give you relevant information early on so that you will spend less time figuring out what their needs are and schedule with 90% of people who contact you. The contact system will also email or send a message to your phone so that you can reply immediately, the first responder normally gets the gig and you only need so many weekly students to fill your schedule. You can also advertise on Craigslist but I had worse clients from Craigslist, they would call and ask questions and not schedule as frequently, they would ask for discounts, etc… I was making $30 an hour after I established myself because I would teach college kids engineering classes and math on campus, very efficient for me, schedule everything back to back on campus.

Due to the growth of busy lifestyle many people nowadays prefer the convenience of online coaching. The growth of technology and the internet has made the experience of online coaching extremely realistic. As a result, the demand for online tutors is growing fast. So if you like helping others to learn, online tutoring could be the earning ticket for you.  Suitable For: People who love to teach and have a gift of imparting knowledge. Skills Required: Expertise in any particular subject you wish to teach such as maths, science, computer programming and so on.A college degree or at least two years of completed study in the subject you wish to teach.Some experience as an online tutor is a plus, but not necessary.How To Get Started: The first and the best way is to enroll with the online tutoring sites, these sites will assign you students based on your profile and schedule. Following is the list of reputed online tutoring sites: http://Tutor.comOnline Tutoring, Homework Help in Math, Science & English By Expert TutorsOnline School | e-TutorOnline Tutoring from Pearson's SmarthinkingThe second way is to start on your own: Create a local ad or flier with your credentials and contact information and place it up in libraries, grocery stores and on community bulletin boards. Ask your friends and relatives to spread the word. Create a Facebook page about your online tutoring class and invite your online friends and acquaintances to like and share it online. Expected Earnings: You will earn from $9 to $40 per hour depending on your reputation and experience. If you are a certified teacher with expertise in subjects such as advanced maths, science, statistics and computer programming, you can charge more than $50 per hour.

Easiest way to go about tutoring is still partnering with some company with their big marketing bucks - taking care of finding you students. And tipping your toe into freelancing when already established some client base. Simple googling gives you results on what market lead tutoring agencies pay their tutors. For example Chegg lists their hourly salary around $20/hour. Number one agency teaching English to the Asian market - VipKid - says their salaries fall between $14 and €22/hour. So you don’t really have a choice there. However, what students are willing to pay depends on the specific economic region and purchasing power. Some averaging $60+/hour in New York. There are platforms, fortunately, allowing tutors more flexibility, where their hourly rates are more free. One giving tutors total freedom in setting their own hourly rates - Tutor.id. Working locally, you could earn a lot more working in New York or Los Angeles with Tutor.id than under a fixed-salaried agency. Another one I’d suggest looking into is MyTutorLab, where your salary depends on your education level and teaching experience, leaving you more wiggle room. Although their current market seems to be limited to Florida and LA. Here’s an article covering the most important questions to ask yourself if you’re thinking of becoming an online tutor, what salary to expect and from where to start - How to become an online tutor and start earning within hours | Tutor.id I hope this gives you, aspiring tutors, some clarity on the next steps towards starting your tutoring hustle.

There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure and especially the love of what you are doing. If you are passionate about teaching then all doors are open for you which will lead you to be a successful online tutor. Being a good tutor you should make your student feel as if you both are going through this journey together. The determination and enthusiasm that stirs within a student and a tutor are heart-warming. Concentrate on your Teaching Skills like- Communication,Listening abilityFlexibility in approachFamiliarity with the course structureThe ability to motivate students andThe ability to deploy resources is highly important.Student-centered approach listening to the needs of the student and reacting suitably. Engaging in question/answer sessions.By breaking a complex problem into pieces and learning each part using a different technique, problem-solving, repetition etc.You’ve got to experiment, be creative and think of what you can bring to your tutorials more effectively.Becoming a tutor with Matr is a great way to get into the tutoring world.

I guess the most important question on any tutor’s mind is HOW DO I GET STUDENTS? Referrals seem to trump all other means of finding students. But referrals only work when you have healthy number of satisfied students. So, HOW DO YOU BUILD YOUR INITIAL STUDENT BASE? Traditional ways of telling your family and posting on Craigslist are still great ways to put your tutoring service out there. But, thanks to technology we also have modern tools that can jump start the search and finding the students we all hope to find. I wrote a detailed post on 7 different ways to finding a student. Tell your family & friendsPost on CraigslistPost in Facebook groupsAttend meetupsUpdate online statusSearch job listing platformsBe part of online platformTutoring jobs: How to find tutoring jobs? (and 7 ways to jump start your search) Disclaimer: I wrote this blogpost In this post I go in detail about each approach and in some cases templates and talking points. Ask: Is there other creative way of finding students that worked for you? Thanks for sharing in advance.

It’s pretty easy to become an online tutor. Most of the time, you will need to register with the tutoring company you want to work with. Make sure you have a good resume. You can always start your own tutoring company. My suggestion is find a good platform, build a good website, and get clients. As always, your students should always be your #1 priority. Good luck!

If you are looking to start online tutoring business and don’t have much idea of what to do and how to do, you have come at the right place.
